results.brief_description: There are two segments - the first with Philip Walsh walking down and back along the old platform 15, 16 during demolition and the second part (and the priority) is of Don Bates presenting the drawings to Nigel Milan from SBS

results.title: Interruptions
results.creator_credit: Thomas MacNeil, William Hoke, Pacific Northwest Bell Telephone Company and Hoke Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how seven individuals have accepted their disabilities and learned to transcend their limitations. It also shows how employers have dispensed of common prejudices and have employed handicapped individuals, and have found them to be effective workers.

results.title: Interrogation of enemy airmen
results.creator_credit: United States. Army Air Forces. First Motion Picture Unit
results.brief_description: An instructional film demonstrating the techniques available to army personnel involved in the interrogation of prisoners of war. Using classroom techniques and role playing scenarios, good and bad methods are demonstrated. Highlights the importance of examining a prisoner’s belongings to establish a personal profile before interrogation commences; shows how to use subordination techniques with captured officers to establish power and control; illustrates methods that may psychologically manipulate a prisoner to devulge intelligence information; shows how to identify the rank of a prisoner. Interrogation segments are in German, Italian and Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Interpolation
results.creator_credit: John Sanborn, Tom Klemesrud, Brian Isaacson, John J. Godfrey, Lamar Howard, M. Scott Cole and Kit Fitzgerald
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Divided into ten abstracted ‘stories,’ this study of sound and image juxtaposition employs rapid cutting as its primary visual strategy. Although such strategies have become standard conventions of music videos and television advertising, the artists broke new ground at the time with fast edits, dissolves, real-time manipulation and altered synchronization of sound and image. In deftly orchestrated interpretations of gesture and movement, simple events are reassembled into compelling compositions - rhythmic, stream-of-consciousness flows of images and sounds that play with illusion and reality. In ‘Entropy’, the everyday ritual of eating breakfast is fragmented into rapid, staccato images and sounds. A new language of sounds and chants is generated through rapid-fire editing and repetition in ‘Aphasia’. Editing and dissolves are used to re-choreograph movement in ‘Motive’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Sanborn, Tom Klemesrud, Brian Isaacson, John J. Godfrey, Lamar Howard, M. Scott Cole and Kit Fitzgerald

results.title: Internal tantrum
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: In Internal Tantrum, Palestine sits before the camera with a severe expression of concentration, his body tense and his fists tightly wound. He begins to slowly chant and sway, evoking a powerful sense of grief and pain. He writes that the tape provides ‘a reading, like on the Richter Scale, of a certain kind of emotional internal roller coaster or earthquake. I used only one tone so the deliverance of energy becomes directly articulated in the sound.’ This performance is a simple yet intense rendering of pain, and the desire to move that pain outward from the internal.

results.title: Interlude by candlelight
results.creator_credit: Charles Van der Linden and Marlina Van der Linden
results.brief_description: The late puppeteer Harry van Tussenbroek used to collect shells, birds’ skulls and pieces of driftwood on the beach, from which he made quaint dolls and puppets. In this film he is seen in his home with his “children”, dreaming by the fire. The dream suddenly takes on a strange twist where the dolls come to life, and in their strange dream-world they play the eternal game of good and evil, of light and darkness. Narrated by Jill Melford. This film is not recommended for showing to young children.

results.title: Intergalactic zoo
results.brief_description: An album of animated characters from a zoo located on Mars. All the characters are created from a string of beads with various distinguishing features added, using normal animation techniques. The characters are creations of a highly imaginative mind and have a simple charm. Any resemblance to living creatures, either on Earth or Mars is purely co-incidental. Animation by Morton Goldsholl.

results.title: Interaction in learning (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert E. Gilbert and Kismet Films
results.brief_description: Uses classroom situations to point out the different types of social interaction that arise during the school years, and the importance of personal contact in solving conflicts in values and broadening the viewpoints of children, especially those from disadvantaged backgrounds.

results.title: Intellectual development in c28hildren
results.brief_description: The film deals with the intellectual development of infants; Piaget’s six stages of sensory-motor activities. According to Piaget, all babies follow the same developmental sequence of activities although not necessarily at the same time. Illustrates the six stages with appropriate commentary using babies from the age of three weeks, to children who can comprehend and are beginning to use speech.

results.title: Integration: a place for everyone
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the integration process at work. Indicates parents’ desires for their disabled children at school. Stresses necessity of support group between school and family and classroom modifications for successful integration. Highlights educational and social benefits for the dissabled child.
